texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed Policy on the Implementation of Reproductive Health Education (RHE) for Adolescent Learners in Basic Education in line with its mandate as stipulated in the Republic Act No. 10354 or the Responsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Law of 2012
texts.text: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed Policy on the Implementation of Reproductive Health Education (RHE) for Adolescent Learners in Basic Education in line with its mandate as stipulated in the Republic Act No. 10354 or the Responsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Law of 2012

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 Through this policy, DepEd commits to providing age-and developmentally appropriate reproductive health education to adolescent   learners, which shall be taught by adequately trained teachers in formal and nonformal educational systems.
texts.text: 2 Through this policy, DepEd commits to providing age-and developmentally appropriate reproductive health education to adolescent   learners, which shall be taught by adequately trained teachers in formal and nonformal educational systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 This Order repeals DepEd Order (DO) No. 031, s 2018 tited Policy Guidelines on the   Implementation of the Comprehensive   Sexuality   Education, and   adopts Reproductive Health Education as the new framework in of Comprehensive Sexuality Education. Moreover, all DOs and other related issuances, provisions, rules, and regulations inconsistent with this policy are hereby repealed place
texts.text: 3 This Order repeals DepEd Order (DO) No. 031, s 2018 tited Policy Guidelines on the   Implementation of the Comprehensive   Sexuality   Education, and   adopts Reproductive Health Education as the new framework in of Comprehensive Sexuality Education. Moreover, all DOs and other related issuances, provisions, rules, and regulations inconsistent with this policy are hereby repealed place

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 This Order shall take effect immediately upon its approval, issuance, and 15 days after its publication in the Official Gazette or a newspaper of general circulation. Certified of this Order shall be registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center (UP LC), UP Diliman, Quezon copies City .

Certified of this Order shall be registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center (UP LC), UP Diliman, Quezon copies City .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: POLICY ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH EDUCATION FOR ADOLESCENT LEARNERS IN BASIC EDUCATION
texts.text: POLICY ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH EDUCATION FOR ADOLESCENT LEARNERS IN BASIC EDUCATION

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: I RATIONALE
texts.text: I RATIONALE

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Republic Act No. (RA) 10354 , otherwise known as ~The Responsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Act of 2012, mandates the State to provide age and developmentally appropriate Reproductive Health Education (RHE) for adolescents. Pursuant to this mandate, the Department of Education (DepEd) hereby issues the   implementing guidelines on RHE to empower learners to make informed and responsible decisions regarding their reproductive health, while promoting inclusivity and safeguarding learners against stigma and gender-based violence.
texts.text: 1 Republic Act No. (RA) 10354 , otherwise known as ~The Responsible Parenthood and Reproductive Health Act of 2012, mandates the State to provide age and developmentally appropriate Reproductive Health Education (RHE) for adolescents. Pursuant to this mandate, the Department of Education (DepEd) hereby issues the   implementing guidelines on RHE to empower learners to make informed and responsible decisions regarding their reproductive health, while promoting inclusivity and safeguarding learners against stigma and gender-based violence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 Fertility and Sexuality Study (2021), and the National Demographic Health Survey (2022) indicate a rising incidence of   adolescent   pregnancies, gender-based  violence, sexually transmitted infections, and HIV cases among the Filipino youth. This trend underscores the urgent need to strengthen and institutionalize a comprehensive policy   framework on Reproductive Health Education
texts.text: 2 Fertility and Sexuality Study (2021), and the National Demographic Health Survey (2022) indicate a rising incidence of   adolescent   pregnancies, gender-based  violence, sexually transmitted infections, and HIV cases among the Filipino youth. This trend underscores the urgent need to strengthen and institutionalize a comprehensive policy   framework on Reproductive Health Education

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 In view of the foregoing, this policy establishes a focused framework for all DepEd offices, personnel, and schools regarding the principles, topics, pedagogical approaches, and monitoring and evaluation mechanisms for the effective   implementation of RHE for adolescent learners in basic education. The RHE program shall be age- and development-appropriate, culturally sensitive, and inclusive. It must also be aligned with the values and contexts of Filipino learners, families, and communities. DepEd shall likewise ensure the promotion of responsible behaviors and values related to reproductive health.
texts.text: 3 In view of the foregoing, this policy establishes a focused framework for all DepEd offices, personnel, and schools regarding the principles, topics, pedagogical approaches, and monitoring and evaluation mechanisms for the effective   implementation of RHE for adolescent learners in basic education. The RHE program shall be age- and development-appropriate, culturally sensitive, and inclusive. It must also be aligned with the values and contexts of Filipino learners, families, and communities. DepEd shall likewise ensure the promotion of responsible behaviors and values related to reproductive health.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 This Order repeals DepEd Order No. (DO) 31, 2018, "Policy Guidelines on the Implementation of the Comprehensive Sexuality Education; and adopts Reproductive Health Education (RHE) as the new framework in place of Comprehensive Sexuality Education (CSE), in accordance with the mandate of RA 10354. The RHE framework refines and strengthens the scope of instruction to address the current and emerging needs of Filipino adolescents while maintaining a more relevant and responsive approach to education.
texts.text: 4 This Order repeals DepEd Order No. (DO) 31, 2018, "Policy Guidelines on the Implementation of the Comprehensive Sexuality Education; and adopts Reproductive Health Education (RHE) as the new framework in place of Comprehensive Sexuality Education (CSE), in accordance with the mandate of RA 10354. The RHE framework refines and strengthens the scope of instruction to address the current and emerging needs of Filipino adolescents while maintaining a more relevant and responsive approach to education.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: II. SCOPE
texts.text: II. SCOPE

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. This   DepEd Order shall   apply to all   public schools and Community Learning Centers (CLCs).
texts.text: This   DepEd Order shall   apply to all   public schools and Community Learning Centers (CLCs).

texts.text: 6 Private schools' may adopt the provisions of these guidelines in developing the

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: III DEFINITION OF TERMS
texts.text: III DEFINITION OF TERMS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9 For the purposes of this policy, the following terms are defined:
texts.text: 9 For the purposes of this policy, the following terms are defined:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.1. Adolescent learners refer to individuals ten (10) to nineteen (19) years [Section 4(b) , RA 10354] who are in transition from childhood to adulthood. aged
texts.text: 9.1. Adolescent learners refer to individuals ten (10) to nineteen (19) years [Section 4(b) , RA 10354] who are in transition from childhood to adulthood. aged

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.2. and Development-Appropriate refers to content and learning   experiences that are consistent with the cognitive, emotional, social, and physical developmental stages of adolescent learners. Age-
texts.text: 9.2. and Development-Appropriate refers to content and learning   experiences that are consistent with the cognitive, emotional, social, and physical developmental stages of adolescent learners. Age-

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.3 Child Protection refers to programs, services, procedures, and structures that are intended to prevent and respond to abuse, neglect, exploitation, discrimination, and violence.
texts.text: 9.3 Child Protection refers to programs, services, procedures, and structures that are intended to prevent and respond to abuse, neglect, exploitation, discrimination, and violence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.4 Children's Rights refers to the right of children to assistance, including proper care and nutrition, and special protection from all forms of neglect, abuse,   cruelty, exploitation, and other conditions prejudicial to their development.
texts.text: 9.4 Children's Rights refers to the right of children to assistance, including proper care and nutrition, and special protection from all forms of neglect, abuse,   cruelty, exploitation, and other conditions prejudicial to their development.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.5 Culturally Sensitive and Contextually Relevant refers to an approach that respects and considers the diverse cultural values,
texts.text: 9.5 Culturally Sensitive and Contextually Relevant refers to an approach that respects and considers the diverse cultural values,

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Id.
texts.text: Id.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: beliefs, and  practices within Filipino   society, while   upholding universal human rights and scientific evidence. It involves adopting RHE content and delivery to be meaningful and acceptable to adolescent learners, parents, and communities.
texts.text: beliefs, and  practices within Filipino   society, while   upholding universal human rights and scientific evidence. It involves adopting RHE content and delivery to be meaningful and acceptable to adolescent learners, parents, and communities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.6 Gender-based Violence (GBV) refers to any act or series of acts of violence inflicted by reason of one's gender which results or likely to result in physical, sexual, psychological harm Or suffering, or economic abuse, including threats of such acts, battery, assault, coercion, harassment, arbitrary deprivation of liberty, and the like.
texts.text: 9.6 Gender-based Violence (GBV) refers to any act or series of acts of violence inflicted by reason of one's gender which results or likely to result in physical, sexual, psychological harm Or suffering, or economic abuse, including threats of such acts, battery, assault, coercion, harassment, arbitrary deprivation of liberty, and the like.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.7 Gender Equality refers to the   principle of   equality between women and men and equal rights to enjoy conditions in realizing their full human potentials to contribute to, and benefit from, the results of development, with the State recognizing that all human are free and equal in dignity and rights. It entails equality in opportunities, in the allocation of resources or benefits, or in access to services  in furtherance of  the rights to health and sustainable human development among others, without discrimination. beings
texts.text: 9.7 Gender Equality refers to the   principle of   equality between women and men and equal rights to enjoy conditions in realizing their full human potentials to contribute to, and benefit from, the results of development, with the State recognizing that all human are free and equal in dignity and rights. It entails equality in opportunities, in the allocation of resources or benefits, or in access to services  in furtherance of  the rights to health and sustainable human development among others, without discrimination. beings

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.8 Gender Equity refers to the policies, instruments, programs and actions that address the disadvantaged   position of women in society by providing preferential treatment and affirmative action. It entails fairness and justice in the distribution of benefits and responsibilities between women and men, and often   requires women-specific projects and programs to end existing inequalities . This concept recognized that while reproductive health involves women and men, it is more critical for women's health.
texts.text: 9.8 Gender Equity refers to the policies, instruments, programs and actions that address the disadvantaged   position of women in society by providing preferential treatment and affirmative action. It entails fairness and justice in the distribution of benefits and responsibilities between women and men, and often   requires women-specific projects and programs to end existing inequalities . This concept recognized that while reproductive health involves women and men, it is more critical for women's health.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.9 Reproductive Health (RH) refers to the state of   complete physical, mental and social well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity, in all matters relating to the reproductive system and to its functions and processes.
texts.text: 9.9 Reproductive Health (RH) refers to the state of   complete physical, mental and social well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity, in all matters relating to the reproductive system and to its functions and processes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.10 Reproductive Health Care Program refers to the systematic and integrated   provision of reproductive health care to all citizens prioritizing women, the poor , marginalized , and those in vulnerable or crisis situations.
texts.text: 9.10 Reproductive Health Care Program refers to the systematic and integrated   provision of reproductive health care to all citizens prioritizing women, the poor , marginalized , and those in vulnerable or crisis situations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.11 . Reproductive Health Education (RHE) refers to a lifelong learning process of providing and acquiring complete, accurate and relevant age- and development-appropriate information and education on reproductive health and sexuality through life skills education and other approaches.
texts.text: 9.11 . Reproductive Health Education (RHE) refers to a lifelong learning process of providing and acquiring complete, accurate and relevant age- and development-appropriate information and education on reproductive health and sexuality through life skills education and other approaches.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In addition, as defined in Section 14 of RA 10354, RHE is age- and development-appropriate that is taught by   adequately trained teachers who would teach the following: values formation; knowledge and skills self-protection  against   discrimination; sexual abuse and violence against women and children and other forms of GBV and teen pregnancy; physical, social and emotional changes in adolescents; women $ rights and children 's rights;
texts.text: In addition, as defined in Section 14 of RA 10354, RHE is age- and development-appropriate that is taught by   adequately trained teachers who would teach the following: values formation; knowledge and skills self-protection  against   discrimination; sexual abuse and violence against women and children and other forms of GBV and teen pregnancy; physical, social and emotional changes in adolescents; women $ rights and children 's rights;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9.12 Sexual Exploitation refers to any means of actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust, for sexual purposes or lewd including profiting monetarily, socially, or politically   from the sexual exploitation of another, regardless of whether or not consent was given. designs,
texts.text: 9.12 Sexual Exploitation refers to any means of actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust, for sexual purposes or lewd including profiting monetarily, socially, or politically   from the sexual exploitation of another, regardless of whether or not consent was given. designs,

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IV. POLICY STATEMENT
texts.text: IV. POLICY STATEMENT

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10 DepEd is committed to providing all Filipino adolescent learners in public schools with quality and relevant basic education, in accordance with national law. This includes equipping them with the necessary knowledge and skills through RHE to lead healthy, safe, and fulfilling lives where individuals prioritize their well-being and the well-being of others.
texts.text: 10 DepEd is committed to providing all Filipino adolescent learners in public schools with quality and relevant basic education, in accordance with national law. This includes equipping them with the necessary knowledge and skills through RHE to lead healthy, safe, and fulfilling lives where individuals prioritize their well-being and the well-being of others.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11 DepEd shall ensure that the curriculum shall instill in our learners the value of making decisions that are free of discrimination, coercion, and violence, and ensure that learners shall have the information and means to do so.
texts.text: 11 DepEd shall ensure that the curriculum shall instill in our learners the value of making decisions that are free of discrimination, coercion, and violence, and ensure that learners shall have the information and means to do so.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12 The implementation of RHE shall be integrated into appropriate learning areas within the K to 12 curriculum for adolescent learners and can be contextualized based on the socio-cultural context of the community or school.
texts.text: 12 The implementation of RHE shall be integrated into appropriate learning areas within the K to 12 curriculum for adolescent learners and can be contextualized based on the socio-cultural context of the community or school.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: V IMPLEMENTING GUIDELINES
texts.text: V IMPLEMENTING GUIDELINES

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13 The implementation of RHE shall be guided by the following principles:
texts.text: 13 The implementation of RHE shall be guided by the following principles:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Alignment with National Laws
texts.text: Alignment with National Laws

texts.label: text
texts.orig: RHE shall be  implemented in strict adherence to RA 10354 , particularly its provisions on age- and development-appropriate reproductive health education for adolescents, and other relevant national laws and policies.
texts.text: RHE shall be  implemented in strict adherence to RA 10354 , particularly its provisions on age- and development-appropriate reproductive health education for adolescents, and other relevant national laws and policies.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.2. Focus on Adolescent Learners
texts.text: 13.2. Focus on Adolescent Learners

texts.label: text
texts.orig: RHE, as defined in this policy, is specifically designed for and directed at adolescent learners, commencing from Grade 5.
texts.text: RHE, as defined in this policy, is specifically designed for and directed at adolescent learners, commencing from Grade 5.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.3. and Development-Appropriate Age-
texts.text: 13.3. and Development-Appropriate Age-

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All RHE content, materials, and teaching methodologies shall be carefully   calibrated to the   cognitive, emotional,  physical, and social maturity of adolescent learners at each grade level (Grades 5 to 12).
texts.text: All RHE content, materials, and teaching methodologies shall be carefully   calibrated to the   cognitive, emotional,  physical, and social maturity of adolescent learners at each grade level (Grades 5 to 12).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Scientifically Accurate and Evidence-Based
texts.text: Scientifically Accurate and Evidence-Based

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Scientifically accurate and evidence-based RHE content shall be based on current scientific evidence and factual information, free
texts.text: Scientifically accurate and evidence-based RHE content shall be based on current scientific evidence and factual information, free

texts.label: text
texts.orig: from myths; misconceptions, and ideologies that arc not supported by science, and shall be subject to impact assessment under RA 11032 as well as monitoring and evaluation under RA 10354
texts.text: from myths; misconceptions, and ideologies that arc not supported by science, and shall be subject to impact assessment under RA 11032 as well as monitoring and evaluation under RA 10354

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.5 Culturally Sensitive and Contextually Relevant
texts.text: 13.5 Culturally Sensitive and Contextually Relevant

texts.label: text
texts.orig: RHE shall respect Filipino cultural values, traditions, and beliefs, while promoting critical thinking and universal values of respect, human   rights, The curriculum shall bc adapted to be meaningful within the local context.
texts.text: RHE shall respect Filipino cultural values, traditions, and beliefs, while promoting critical thinking and universal values of respect, human   rights, The curriculum shall bc adapted to be meaningful within the local context.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.6 Gender-Responsive and Non-Discriminatory
texts.text: 13.6 Gender-Responsive and Non-Discriminatory

texts.label: text
texts.orig: RHE shall promote gender equality, address GBV, and foster an inclusive environment for the purpose of developing necessary life skills for all adolescent learners regardless of their differences.
texts.text: RHE shall promote gender equality, address GBV, and foster an inclusive environment for the purpose of developing necessary life skills for all adolescent learners regardless of their differences.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.7. Parental Involvement and Responsibility
texts.text: 13.7. Parental Involvement and Responsibility

texts.label: text
texts.orig: DepEd recognizes the primary role of parents in educating their children and respects their   primary right their children   according to their beliefs and backgrounds. RHE in public schools is designed to complement and support parental guidance for adolescent   learners Public   schools shall   actively engage parents of adolescent learners through information dissemination, consultations, and capacity-building activities to foster understanding and support for RHE.
texts.text: DepEd recognizes the primary role of parents in educating their children and respects their   primary right their children   according to their beliefs and backgrounds. RHE in public schools is designed to complement and support parental guidance for adolescent   learners Public   schools shall   actively engage parents of adolescent learners through information dissemination, consultations, and capacity-building activities to foster understanding and support for RHE.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.8 Teacher Capacity and Support
texts.text: 13.8 Teacher Capacity and Support

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Adequately trained teachers are essential to the effective delivery of the RHE. Toward this end, DepEd shall ensure that its school teachers are provided with adequate training, resources, continuous professional development, and appropriate support to deliver RHE competently, confidently, and with sensitivity. Such training shall also cover referral   systems and child   protection protocols. Whenever   possible, DepEd shall also share relevant resources to private schools for use in their respective professional development initiatives.
texts.text: Adequately trained teachers are essential to the effective delivery of the RHE. Toward this end, DepEd shall ensure that its school teachers are provided with adequate training, resources, continuous professional development, and appropriate support to deliver RHE competently, confidently, and with sensitivity. Such training shall also cover referral   systems and child   protection protocols. Whenever   possible, DepEd shall also share relevant resources to private schools for use in their respective professional development initiatives.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.9 Protection of Learners
texts.text: 13.9 Protection of Learners

texts.label: text
texts.orig: RHE shall be delivered in a safe, supportive, and non discriminatory   learning environment for adolescent learners. Adaptive mechanisms shall be in place to protect learners from any form of abuse, discrimination, or inappropriate content. RHE messages should be clear and unambiguous in leading adolescent learners towards sexual risk avoidance.
texts.text: RHE shall be delivered in a safe, supportive, and non discriminatory   learning environment for adolescent learners. Adaptive mechanisms shall be in place to protect learners from any form of abuse, discrimination, or inappropriate content. RHE messages should be clear and unambiguous in leading adolescent learners towards sexual risk avoidance.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: MONITORING
texts.text: MONITORING

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.1 The   Reproductive Health Education (RHE) Framework   places adolescent learners at its center, providing them with the necessary guidance and support to grow into respectful, informed, and responsible citizens.
texts.text: 14.1 The   Reproductive Health Education (RHE) Framework   places adolescent learners at its center, providing them with the necessary guidance and support to grow into respectful, informed, and responsible citizens.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.2 RHE emphasizes values formation, holistic adolescent development, and the protection of their rights, with the aim of nurturing respectfulness,  ensuring learners are well-informed , and instilling a strong sense of responsibility among adolescents.
texts.text: 14.2 RHE emphasizes values formation, holistic adolescent development, and the protection of their rights, with the aim of nurturing respectfulness,  ensuring learners are well-informed , and instilling a strong sense of responsibility among adolescents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.3 Learners shall be surrounded by a supportive system built on a strong curriculum, effective pedagogy, and appropriate learning resources:
texts.text: 14.3 Learners shall be surrounded by a supportive system built on a strong curriculum, effective pedagogy, and appropriate learning resources:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.4 The active participation of stakeholders, including but not limited to parents, parent-substitutes, guardians, teachers, community associations, school officials, and institutions such as Local Government Units  (LGUs), Parent-Teacher Associations (PTAs), Indigenous Peoples (IP) Groups, Civil Society Organizations (CSOs), Non-Government Organizations (NGOs), adolescent / youth-led groups, reproductive health   professionals and faith based groups are essential to the effective implementation of the policy .
texts.text: 14.4 The active participation of stakeholders, including but not limited to parents, parent-substitutes, guardians, teachers, community associations, school officials, and institutions such as Local Government Units  (LGUs), Parent-Teacher Associations (PTAs), Indigenous Peoples (IP) Groups, Civil Society Organizations (CSOs), Non-Government Organizations (NGOs), adolescent / youth-led groups, reproductive health   professionals and faith based groups are essential to the effective implementation of the policy .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.5 Regular monitoring and evaluation shall be undertaken to generate relevant and timely feedback. Equally important is the continuous updating of delivery mechanisms, complemented by capacity-building programs for both teachers and parents.
texts.text: 14.5 Regular monitoring and evaluation shall be undertaken to generate relevant and timely feedback. Equally important is the continuous updating of delivery mechanisms, complemented by capacity-building programs for both teachers and parents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.6 Overall, the framework promotes a collaborative, whole-of-nation approach to empower adolescent learners with the knowledge, skills, and values needed to make healthy and responsible choices about their reproductive health.
texts.text: 14.6 Overall, the framework promotes a collaborative, whole-of-nation approach to empower adolescent learners with the knowledge, skills, and values needed to make healthy and responsible choices about their reproductive health.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VI. CURRICULUM DELIVERY AND SUPPORT STRUCTURES
texts.text: VI. CURRICULUM DELIVERY AND SUPPORT STRUCTURES

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 15 Curriculum Development
texts.text: 15 Curriculum Development

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Learning Systems (LS) Strand, in coordination with relevant DepEd offices, shall ensure that RHE competencies under the RHE curriculum are clearly articulated and appropriately   integrated into the learning competencies of relevant subjects for adolescent learners in schools in a manner that is age- and development-appropriate.
texts.text: The Learning Systems (LS) Strand, in coordination with relevant DepEd offices, shall ensure that RHE competencies under the RHE curriculum are clearly articulated and appropriately   integrated into the learning competencies of relevant subjects for adolescent learners in schools in a manner that is age- and development-appropriate.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The teaching and learning objectives shall begin with foundational information simple cognitive tasks, and basic skills development activities, which will gradually progress in complexity.
texts.text: The teaching and learning objectives shall begin with foundational information simple cognitive tasks, and basic skills development activities, which will gradually progress in complexity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16 Learning Resource Development
texts.text: 16 Learning Resource Development

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The LS Strand shall oversee the development, review, and approval of learning resources including, but not limited to textbooks, teacher's guides, and supplementary materials pertaining to RHE for adolescent learners in DepEd schools A stringent review process of the learning resources shall involve subject matter experts, child protection specialists, and representatives from relevant stakeholders.
texts.text: The LS Strand shall oversee the development, review, and approval of learning resources including, but not limited to textbooks, teacher's guides, and supplementary materials pertaining to RHE for adolescent learners in DepEd schools A stringent review process of the learning resources shall involve subject matter experts, child protection specialists, and representatives from relevant stakeholders.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 17. Contextualization
texts.text: 17. Contextualization

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Schools may  contextualize RHE content, materials, and strategies to reflect local cultural, social, environmental, and situational contexts Such contextualization shall be undertaken through the Schools Division Offices (SDOs), subject to the approval of the Regional Offices (ROs) and with corresponding reports submitted to the LS Strand. Contextualization must enhance learner   engagement and   relevance, while   maintaining alignment to national RHE competencies and standards.
texts.text: Schools may  contextualize RHE content, materials, and strategies to reflect local cultural, social, environmental, and situational contexts Such contextualization shall be undertaken through the Schools Division Offices (SDOs), subject to the approval of the Regional Offices (ROs) and with corresponding reports submitted to the LS Strand. Contextualization must enhance learner   engagement and   relevance, while   maintaining alignment to national RHE competencies and standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 18 Teacher Training and Capacity Building
texts.text: 18 Teacher Training and Capacity Building

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The National Educators Academy of the Philippines (NEAP) , in collaboration with other relevant   strands or offices, shall design   and implement a comprehensive capacity-building program for teachers, school heads, and school guidance counselors / associates / designates in DepEd schools involved in delivering RHE to adolescent learners.
texts.text: The National Educators Academy of the Philippines (NEAP) , in collaboration with other relevant   strands or offices, shall design   and implement a comprehensive capacity-building program for teachers, school heads, and school guidance counselors / associates / designates in DepEd schools involved in delivering RHE to adolescent learners.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: To achieve the objectives of RHE, the trainings shall include, but are not limited to:
texts.text: To achieve the objectives of RHE, the trainings shall include, but are not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18.1 Understanding the principles, content, and pedagogical approaches of RHE for adolescent learners as outlincd in this policy;
texts.text: 18.1 Understanding the principles, content, and pedagogical approaches of RHE for adolescent learners as outlincd in this policy;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18.2 Addressing personal biases, by facilitating self-improvement seminars and capacity-building activities on values, beliefs, and
texts.text: 18.2 Addressing personal biases, by facilitating self-improvement seminars and capacity-building activities on values, beliefs, and

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: JI
texts.text: JI

texts.label: text
texts.orig: gender sensitivity to ensure the objective, respectful, and inclusive delivery;
texts.text: gender sensitivity to ensure the objective, respectful, and inclusive delivery;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18.4 Responding to adolescent learners questions and concerns appropriately;
texts.text: 18.4 Responding to adolescent learners questions and concerns appropriately;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18.3. Enhancing  facilitation skills for  handling sensitive topics with adolescent learners in a nondiscriminatory, respectful, and effective manner;
texts.text: 18.3. Enhancing  facilitation skills for  handling sensitive topics with adolescent learners in a nondiscriminatory, respectful, and effective manner;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18.5. Understanding child protection, learner-responsive health services, and other referral mechanisms relevant to adolescents;
texts.text: 18.5. Understanding child protection, learner-responsive health services, and other referral mechanisms relevant to adolescents;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18.7. Acquiring skills in psychosocial support and psychological first aid.
texts.text: 18.7. Acquiring skills in psychosocial support and psychological first aid.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18.6 Engaging parents of adolescent learners and the community on RHE; and
texts.text: 18.6 Engaging parents of adolescent learners and the community on RHE; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Master Trainers for RHE shall be identified at the national, regional, and division levels for the DepEd schools.
texts.text: Master Trainers for RHE shall be identified at the national, regional, and division levels for the DepEd schools.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 19 Parental Engagement
texts.text: 19 Parental Engagement

texts.label: text
texts.orig: DepEd schools shall conduct regular orientations and consultations with and those  exercising parental authority over adolescent learners to discuss RHE, its rationale, content, and the roles of both the school and home in RHE for adolescent learners
texts.text: DepEd schools shall conduct regular orientations and consultations with and those  exercising parental authority over adolescent learners to discuss RHE, its rationale, content, and the roles of both the school and home in RHE for adolescent learners

texts.orig: 20. Coordination and Partnerships
texts.text: 20. Coordination and Partnerships

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The DepEd Central Office (CO), through the relevant strands and bureaus, shall  coordinate with the following to ensure a harmonized and multi sectoral approach to RHE:
texts.text: The DepEd Central Office (CO), through the relevant strands and bureaus, shall  coordinate with the following to ensure a harmonized and multi sectoral approach to RHE:

texts.text: 20.1 Department of Health (DOH)

texts.text: 20.3. Department of Economy, Planning, and Development (DEPDev)

texts.text: 20.5 Local Government Units (LGUs)

texts.orig: VIII. FUNDING SOURCES AND REQUIREMENTS
texts.text: VIII. FUNDING SOURCES AND REQUIREMENTS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22. Fund sources will come from the following:
texts.text: Fund sources will come from the following:

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: J1
texts.text: J1

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22.1 . Funding for curriculum development, monitoring and evaluation, and the delivery of technical assistance shall be sourced from Basic Education Curriculum (BEC) funds;
texts.text: 22.1 . Funding for curriculum development, monitoring and evaluation, and the delivery of technical assistance shall be sourced from Basic Education Curriculum (BEC) funds;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22.3. Costs for teaching and learning resources shall be sourced from LS Strand funds;
texts.text: 22.3. Costs for teaching and learning resources shall be sourced from LS Strand funds;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22.2 Orientation and training costs for teachers and implementers shall be sourced from NEAP funds;
texts.text: 22.2 Orientation and training costs for teachers and implementers shall be sourced from NEAP funds;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22.4 Funding for existing health and nutrition programs, guidance and counseling services, and reproductive health care initiatives , as well as the activation and mobilization of youth and adolescent organizations in public schools, shall be charged against Learner Support Program (LSP) funds; and
texts.text: 22.4 Funding for existing health and nutrition programs, guidance and counseling services, and reproductive health care initiatives , as well as the activation and mobilization of youth and adolescent organizations in public schools, shall be charged against Learner Support Program (LSP) funds; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The implementation of child   protection mechanisms such as school-based policies, capacity building for child protection committees , and referral   support for at-risk learners shall be supported through the Child Protection   Program Funding may also be sourced from other agencies   and /or development partners.
texts.text: The implementation of child   protection mechanisms such as school-based policies, capacity building for child protection committees , and referral   support for at-risk learners shall be supported through the Child Protection   Program Funding may also be sourced from other agencies   and /or development partners.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: These are subject to standard budgeting,   accounting;   auditing, and procurement rules and regulations.
texts.text: These are subject to standard budgeting,   accounting;   auditing, and procurement rules and regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 23 The specific fund allocation and utilization thereof will be released in a separate issuance.
texts.text: 23 The specific fund allocation and utilization thereof will be released in a separate issuance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MONITORING AND EVALUATION
texts.text: MONITORING AND EVALUATION

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24 . A comprehensive Monitoring and Evaluation (M8E) framework for RHE implementation shall be developed by the LS and OPS Strands in coordination with StratMa Strand, and in consultation with relevant stakeholders.
texts.text: 24 . A comprehensive Monitoring and Evaluation (M8E) framework for RHE implementation shall be developed by the LS and OPS Strands in coordination with StratMa Strand, and in consultation with relevant stakeholders.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 25. The LS and OPS Strands shall conduct regular M8E and gather feedback on the RHE implementation from all concerned internal and external stakeholders . It shall conduct a period review of this policy to further enhance its provision and effectiveness.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 27 These guidelines   shall take effect fifteen (15) after its approval, issuance, and publication on the DepEd website and in the Official Gazette or a newspaper of general circulation. Certified of this Order shall be   registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University UP Diliman, Quezon days copies City.
texts.text: 27 These guidelines   shall take effect fifteen (15) after its approval, issuance, and publication on the DepEd website and in the Official Gazette or a newspaper of general circulation. Certified of this Order shall be   registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University UP Diliman, Quezon days copies City.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 28 All previous DepEd issuances or provisions thereof that are inconsistent with this Order are hereby repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly.
texts.text: 28 All previous DepEd issuances or provisions thereof that are inconsistent with this Order are hereby repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: TRANSITORY PROVISIONS
texts.text: TRANSITORY PROVISIONS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 29 During the implementation of this Order, DepEd offices and schools shall prioritize the orientation of personnel, capacity building of teachers, and information dissemination to parents of adolescent learners and communities regarding this revised RHE policy .
texts.text: 29 During the implementation of this Order, DepEd offices and schools shall prioritize the orientation of personnel, capacity building of teachers, and information dissemination to parents of adolescent learners and communities regarding this revised RHE policy .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In this regard, DepEd shall develop and issue supplementary guidelines that will set   forth clear methodologies, instructional   approaches, and standards for the effective teaching and delivery of RHE lessons and topics.
texts.text: In this regard, DepEd shall develop and issue supplementary guidelines that will set   forth clear methodologies, instructional   approaches, and standards for the effective teaching and delivery of RHE lessons and topics.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 30 DepEd, through the Bureau of Alternative Education and the Indigenous Peoples   Education   Office, in coordination with ROs and SDOs, shall ensure integration of RHE competencies in non-formal, community-based, and indigenous learning systems. RHE content and approaches shall be adapted to specific cultural and social contexts of learners while remaining aligned with national RHE standards_ Partnerships with local governments, community elders, and civil society organizations shall be encouraged to support implementation and strategies and strengthen learner engagement.
texts.text: 30 DepEd, through the Bureau of Alternative Education and the Indigenous Peoples   Education   Office, in coordination with ROs and SDOs, shall ensure integration of RHE competencies in non-formal, community-based, and indigenous learning systems. texts.orig: 32. Subject to the issuance of further guidelines, DepEd shall integrate basic and age-appropriate instruction on the causes, modes of transmission, and ways of preventing the spread of HIV and AIDS and other STIs into the curricula of   public and   private   learning   institutions;   including alternative and indigenous   learning systems in accordance with RA 11166, otherwise known as "The Philippine HIV and AIDS Policy Act.
